channel.title: Sapicic Daily Bulletin – June Edition
channel.description: Official news from the United Republic of Sapicic – powered by vibes, regulated by aesthetics.

item.title: 🏦 Sapicic International Bank Enters Public Beta
item.description: June 8 marks the public beta launch of Sapicic International Bank (SIB)! Fully digital, fully extra — with biometric vibe scans and budgeting alerts.

item.title: 🚇 Central Heights Metro Expands with New Lines
item.description: Phase 2 of the Central Heights City Metro (CHCM) is live! New maglev lines and immersive light art turn every commute into a gallery experience.

item.title: 🧪 Creative Q.L.E.D. Zones Coming to Riversong
item.description: Experimental Creative and Q.L.E.D. Zones launch in Riversong, featuring glowing roads, semi-sentient lampposts, and cafés that accept poetry as currency.

item.title: 📈 Stock Market Launching This Month
item.description: Invest in local legends like TSPPL, IRND, and ZSI. Here, vibes outperform profit margins. 💸

item.title: 📐 Aesthetic Compliance Code Rolls Out
item.description: Starting June 7, all cities must reduce chaos per block and align to Sapicic's Aesthetic Compliance Code. Stylish order incoming.

item.title: 🎓 Students Demand Curriculum Overhaul
item.description: Avaneesh University students demand more structured, creative syllabi. “More drawing classes, fewer disconnected metaphors.”

item.title: 🌿 Purple Line Delayed by Rogue Plant
item.description: A plant at Botanic Center shut down the Purple Line and now stars in an art piece titled ‘Flora vs. Infrastructure.’

item.title: 🏠 Leaked Housing Code Sparks Debate
item.description: Leaked Artistic Compliance Code draft suggests banning rentals in favor of homeownership. Critics say ‘unhinged utopia.’
